alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 2:36PM MST until October 02 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST/545 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR APACHE COUNTY NEAR ROUGH ROCK... At 234 PM MST /334 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain from thunderstorms has decreased in intensity across the warned area. However, flash flooding is still expected as water drains. Between 0.75 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rough Rock and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oraibi Wash, Trading Post Wash and Burro Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
